outputs.output_descr: The Project is aimed at physical infrastructure development and building institutional capacity. These objectives will support the University of Juba College of Law (UJCL) to achieve its mission of laying a strong foundation for a united, peaceful and prosperous society based on knowledge, justice, equality, respect for human rights and the rule of law premised on access to legal education and knowledge. This is a pivotal concept for a solid, democratic Southern Sudan based on the adherence to respect for the rule of law.

The project supports the CPA implementation and peaceful resolution of conflicts in Southern Sudan through: Capacity Development and training of  CBOs on Human Rights and Access to Justice; Capacity development support to professional legal associations  and JCCs; Support to rule of law  forum and coordination mechanisms; and  Support to the Southern Sudan Human Rights Commission (SSHRC)

donor_name: DEPT OF FOR AFF & INTL TRADE GOV CANADA
outputs.output_descr: Develop a strategy to strengthen the customary laws as per the provisions made in the CPA and Interim National Constitution and Interim Constitution of South Sudan for which customary law has been recognized as a vitally important aspect of community identity and governance. Impact of customary law on the rule of law system are numerous and implicate issues such as criminal behavior, marriage and family concerns, inheritance, property ownership, rights over grazing routes and natural resources, and human rights. The project supports customary law machismos and institutions.

The greatest challenge exists in Jonglei State, which is characterized by an on-going conflict between Lou Nuer, Dinka and Murle tribal groups.  There is the potential for a significant escalation in violence, which constitutes a threat to the stability in Southern Sudan as a whole, and a disruption of relative peace during a critical time for CPA-implementation. UNMIS, UNDP and donors alike recognize the need for a system-wide approach to justice and security sector coordination. The objective of the Jonglei Justice Project (JJP) is to ensure a stronger dimension on justice and peaceful conflict resolution to mitigate violent conflict and strengthen the rule of law and civilian governance.  To address this, JJP will prioritise capacity building of formal justice actors to deal with serious crimes, capacity building of informal justice actors and the construction of rule of law institution buildings in Akobo and Pibor

The project supports the CPA implementation and peaceful resolution of conflicts in Southern Sudan through: Capacity Development and training of  CBOs on Human Rights and Access to Justice; Capacity development support to professional legal associations  and JCCs; Support to rule of law  forum and coordination mechanisms; and  Support to the Southern Sudan Human Rights Commission (SSHRC)

project_descr: Access to Justice and Fostering a Culture of Human Rights Awareness Project
